content: Hey! Our organization settings sidebar feels out of order in a few ways, so I filed #23233 to get it organized a bit better. Posting here for discussion -- I'm happy to update the issue if we come up with a better ordering.
We can also consider more serious changes to how the settings menus are organized, but should save that discussion for after the 6.0 release.

I also noticed that some icons in the sidebar don't match very well with what they are representing. Proposed changes:

  • Organization setting: Replace the beaker with https://fontawesome.com/v4/icon/sliders
  • Deactivated users: Replace the trash can with our "Deactivate user" icon, i.e. https://fontawesome.com/v4/icon/user-times

Thoughts? I don't think we should do a major icon redesign project for that area right now, so the proposal is to make some quick improvements.

The other icon I'd love to change is Custom profile fields, which currently uses the same icon as Users. Some ideas:

  • The Organization profile icon would actually be quite appropriate for custom fields, but then what should we use for the Organization profile tab?
    Screen-Shot-2022-10-13-at-11.48.39-AM.png

  • This is a bit silly, but we could use the inverted version of the Oganization profile icon?
    Screen-Shot-2022-10-13-at-11.47.28-AM.png

  • Alternately, maybe a pencil-based icon would work?
    Screen-Shot-2022-10-13-at-11.48.02-AM.png
We can use a office building icon for the Organisation profile icon, such as corporate fare icon.
Admin panel settings icon for "Default user settings"
I prefer to work on that window as a whole not on parts. If you just tuning some aspects of that in the current design I don't have any strong opinions

Sayam Samal said:

We can use a office building icon for the Organisation profile icon, such as corporate fare icon.

Hmm, maybe, though I wonder if it would feel odd to non-business organizations?

Sayam Samal said:

Admin panel settings icon for "Default user settings"

Hm, the shield doesn't really say "settings" to me. It looks more like what I'd expect for permissions, rather than things like whether we default to light theme or dark.

Sayam Samal said:

Finally, Manage accounts icon for "Users" settings.

That one might look good on its own, but will be strange next to https://fontawesome.com/v4/icon/user-times, if we use that one.
Anyway, since we aren't doing an overall redesign, I mostly want to focus on tactically improving the ones that seem really off.

As a first pass, using the profile icon twice is probably fine; they're far enough apart in the proposed ordering that it isn't likely to be distracting/important; and I think the other improvements proposed seem very much worth doing.
